snippet: At least 11 were killed in the attacks, a reminder that as the last Western troops withdraw, the Afghan forces will be hard-pressed just to hold ground.
abstract: Taliban mounts attacks in three provinces in Afghanistan that kill at least 11 people on the first day of their 'spring offensive'; attacks are a reminder that as the last of the Western troops withdraw in the coming months, Afghan forces will be in an unrelenting fight just to hold ground.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan, and Khalid Alokozay from Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: At least 11 were killed in the attacks, a reminder that as the last Western troops withdraw, the Afghan forces will be hard-pressed just to hold ground.

headline.main: Taliban Wage Deadly Attacks in 3 Afghan Provinces
headline.print_headline: Taliban Wage Deadly Attacks in 3 Afghan Provinces
